briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Oral Immunotherapy With GcMAF in Hospitalized Patients With COVID-19 Pneumonia
officialTitle: Phase II Clinical Trial Evaluating Efficacy and Safety of Oral Immunotherapy With Third Generation Gc Protein Derived Macrophage Activating Factor (GcMAF) in Hospitalized Patients With COVID-19 Pneumonia: the COral-MAF1 Trial

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

primary.measure: the rate of transfer to the intensive care unit (ICU)
primary.description: the proportion of hospitalized patients requiring intensive care management because of worsening respiratory function (PaO2/FiO2 ratio \<150 mmHg) and/or development of multi-organ dysfunction and/or other clinical conditions needing invasive mechanical ventilation Given that 26% of patients required intensive care unit treatment, the purpose of this trial is to achieve a reduction of at least 50% of this value with an overall rate of transfer to the ICU of 13%.

secondary.measure: Changes from baseline to subsequent timepoints (when available) in terms of percentage of lung involvement (lung consolidation, ground glass opacities and disease free).
secondary.description: CT visual quantitative evaluation will be based on summing up the acute lung inflammatory lesions involving each lobe, which was scored as 0 (0%), 1 (1-25%), 2 (26-50%), 3 (51-75%), or 4 (76-100%), respectively. In particular, an early reduction from 85% to 50% in imaging progression on chest CT at day 7 will be evaluated, as a surrogate endpoint

secondary.measure: days with use of supplemental O2

secondary.description: proportion of patients with COVID-19 symptoms worsening.

time to resolution of fever (for at least 48 hours) in absence of antipyretics, or discharge, whichever is sooner in the 4-week period after study treatment. Resolution of fever is defined as body temperature: ≤36.6°C (axilla) or ≤37.2 °C (oral), or ≤37.8 °C (rectal or tympanic). Fever is defined as defined as body temperature \> 37.4°C \[axilla\], or \> 38.0 °C \[oral\], or \>38.4°C \[rectal or tympanic\];
progression of respiratory failure as evaluated by the PaO2/FiO2 ratio
proportion of patients requiring implementation of supplemental oxygen during the 28-day period

secondary.measure: changes from baseline in white blood cell count (WBC)
secondary.description: changes from baseline in white blood cell count (WBC)

secondary.measure: MAF precursor activity of serum Gc protein
secondary.description: changes from baseline in MAF precursor activity of serum Gc protein as marker for response to treatment
changes from baseline in serum nagalase activity, as marker for response to treatment;

secondary.measure: viral loads detected in nasopharyngeal swabs
secondary.description: kinetic changes of viral loads detected in nasopharyngeal swabs

secondary.measure: Serious Adverse Events (SAE) and Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR) (expected and unexpected)
secondary.description: number of Serious Adverse Events (SAE) and Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR) (expected and unexpected)
